lead_paragraph: 150, and Counting It was born on Sept. 18, 1851, as the New-York Daily Times, the dream of a charismatic, high-minded, quixotic journalist-politician named Henry Jarvis Raymond. Along the way to the information age, it broke ground with coverage of war and scandal, disaster and politics -- and nearly died several times. Today, in a special section, The Times observes its 150th birthday, slightly belated, with articles and reminiscences by Michael Chabon, David Halberstam, Anna Quindlen, Frank Rich and others. SECTION H
